description:
Withdrawal of the driving licence

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
24311 Criminal prosecution statistics

Definition:
The withdrawal of the driving licence (ban) is provided for
in the Criminal Code as a measure of rehabilitation and
incapacitation if a criminal offence was committed in
connection with the driving of a motor vehicle or in
violation of the duties of a driver of a motor vehicle. The
driving licence may also be withdrawn or a period may be
ordered before a (new) driving licence may be issued (ban)
if the person cannot be convicted because he/she has acted
in a state of insanity.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2017
name: Withdrawal of the driving licence
